Bibliography

course bibliography and references for COMP 436

The course ‘bibliography & references’ will be updated on a weekly basis with suggested reading, which will reflect each week’s course notes and lecture.

References will be cited at the end of each week’s notes.

There is no specific textbook for this course.

Week 11 - 7th November 2018
  • MDN - XPath functions
  • XPath Version 1.0
  • XPath Version 2
Week 10 - 31st October 2018
  • MDN - XPath functions
Week 9 - 24th October 2018
  • XPath Version 1.0
  • XPath Version 2
Week 8 - 17th October 2018
  • XML.com - What is XSL-FO
  • XMLNS - FOAF spec
  • XPath Version 1.0
  • W3Schools - XPath
Week 7 - 10th October 2018
  • W3C - GRDDL
  • W3C - OWL
  • W3C - RDF
  • W3C - SPARQL
  • Xalan Project
Week 6 - 3rd October 2018
  • Oxygen XSLT Processors
  • W3C - XML well formed
  • W3C - XSLT 1.0
Week 5 - 26th September 2018
  • N/A
Week 4 - 19th September 2018
  • IETF - Uniform Resource Names
  • W3C - XML well formed
  • Wikipedia - list of XML markup languages
Week 3 - 12th September 2018
  • MDN - HTML Block-level vs Inline
  • MDN - HTML <b> element
  • MDN - HTML Global Attributes
  • MDN - HTML Heading elements
  • MDN - HTML <table> element
  • MDN - HTML <ul> element
  • Wikipedia - list of XML markup languages
Week 2 - 5th September 2018
  • MDN web docs - HTML Block-level vs Inline
  • MDN web docs - HTML Global Attributes
  • MDN web docs - HTML Heading elements
Week 1 - 29th August 2018
  • Smith, Abby. Why Digitize? Washington, D.C.: Council on Library and Information Resources. 1999.
  • Unknown. “The Great Analog Versus Digital Debate”. VoicePrint Online. 2004.
